phase_1.deliverable: 23 tools documented with parameters, purpose, limitations, capabilities, gaps, dependencies, automation potential

findings.critical_insight: System is ORCHESTRATION-CENTRIC (guides agents through phases) not AUTOMATION-CENTRIC (agents do actual work). Plan generation, context gathering, and deliverables tracking are semi-automated (templates + agent input).

phase_2.task: Cross-server sync - analyze automation bottlenecks, integration needs

findings.dependency_structure: 4-server system with clear architectural layers: (1) Intelligence Layer (coderef-context), (2) Planning/Orchestration Layer (coderef-workflow), (3) Documentation Layer (coderef-docs), (4) Personality Layer (coderef-personas)
findings.critical_risk: 95% system dependency on coderef-context availability - 3/4 servers fail without it. Zero redundancy or fallbacks
findings.integration_opportunities: High-value gaps: (1) coderef-docs ignores code intelligence despite duplicate pattern scanning, (2) coderef-workflow and personas not semantically integrated for agent selection, (3) Two independent quality gates (workflow validation + docs standards)
priority_recommendations: Implement caching layer for coderef-context (repeated queries expensive)
Decouple via message queues/events (reduce direct dependencies)
Build real-time dashboard for agent coordination (replace manual JSON updates)
Add persona recommendation engine to workflow
Unify quality gates across workflow and docs

phase_3_ready.note: coderef-context, coderef-docs, coderef-personas Phase 1 analyses already complete. Awaiting any remaining individual analyses, then Phase 3 aggregation can proceed
phase_3_ready.next_task: Phase 3: Aggregate roadmap - synthesis of all findings into concrete improvement plan with priorities and resource estimates
